doc.name: environment
doc.summary: Returns the type of running environment the stack is in.

examples.example: if the environment is "development" then showDevelopOptions

description.overview: Use the environment function to change a stack's behavior depending on how the stack was opened.
description.value: The environment function returns one of "development", "standalone application", "helper application", "browser" or "mobile"
description.comments:
If the environment function returns "development", the stack is running under the development environment.
If the environment function returns "standalone application", the stack is running as a standalone application.
If the environment function returns "helper application", LiveCode is running as a standalone with secureMode set to true.
If the environment function returns "browser" the stack is running as a LiveCode applet.
If the environment function returns "mobile" the stack is running on a mobile device.
